intro: Pisonia obtusata var. domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pendulous flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a leathery texture, while its fruits are follicles that split open to release small, hairy seeds. This species is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils.
